diaper.description: Felix loves to be naked. If it's warm enough, we let him roam around in his nappie.
diaper.title: Diaper

drawing.description: Now and then, we offer markers and paper to Felix. He is starting to do a few scribbles, but his favorite part is still taking the caps on and off.
drawing.title: Drawing

food-sign.description: Here, Felix is using his baby sign for food to describe the drawing on the page, not because he is hungry. A first!
food-sign.title: Food Sign

hign-tea1.description: Our friends dTodd and Diana hosted a fancy High Tea this Sunday, complete with scones and finger sandwiches. Mikek dressed to impress.
hign-tea1.title: Hign Tea 1

hign-tea3.description: Felix rejected the watercress sandwishes, but he approved of the ones with banana and honey.
hign-tea3.title: Hign Tea 3

hign-tea7.description: While the grown-ups partake is light after-tea conversation, the lads (Ezekiel, Moses and Felix) rumble with a ball.
hign-tea7.title: Hign Tea 7

description:
Felix continues to enchant us with his language exploration. More and more, he wants to tell us about things just for the sake of conversation, instead of for expressing a need. On Wednesday, on the way back from our weekly swimming-pool session, Felix babbled with enthusiasm on the back seat, incorporating swimming-related signs ("water", "fish", and hand motions to the song we sing at the pool).

New words:

  • ack ack ack [+ flapping hand] Bird. This started as "quack quack", the sound the duck makes. Now, Felix has coupled it with his sign for bird (flapping hand), and he's been very busy spotting birds everywhere.
  • bo: Bottle. When Felix really wants a bottle, he does the food sign (fingers to mouth), takes us to the microwave, and shakes his hand like he is counting down. If we still don't make him a bottle, he asks for "bo! bo! bo!"
  • ba: Ball. Felix is such a big fan of the "ba" sound, it's hard to be sure when he means it as a word. Babar and bubble (both pronounced"baba", more or less) have disappeared from his vocabulary; however, he does seem to say "ba" even more than usual when a ball is around.

See this week's video.
title: April 27
